ags:resource.dc:title: Energy utilization of straw in grain drying

dc:title.dcterms:alternative: Energetické využitie slamy pri sušení zrnín

dc:creator.ags:creatorCorporate: Slovak University of Agriculture in Nitra, Nitra, Slovak Republic, email: xfrolo@is.uniag.sk

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: We were focused in a given contribution is to calculate and compare the expenses for the grain drying by natural gas and straw combustion. A studied drier has been owned by a specific agriculture cooperative in Selice. From the submitted work emerges that straw is the most economical source of energy for grain drying. Straw as a biomass is an energetical raw material and at the present time it represents advantageous substitution of natural gas. Considering the feating capacity, 2,5 kg of straw substitutes 1 m3 of natural gas. The straw has the lowest production costs in comparing with alternative sources of energy from waste biomass. Recoverability of investments for furnaces and additional equipment for biomass oscillates between 3 to 7 years. The aim of the submitted work was to economically evaluate and technologically describe the furnace after reconstruction with the following change to alternative fuel, also a way of heating when drying the specific amount of grain and further to explain numerically, in the case of evaluated cooperative, the investment recoverability after installing the furnace with equipment or to propose other alternative source of energy of the grain drying.
